Package xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels

The package xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels provides concrete kernels and abstract modellings.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
KernelFunctionND Classes implementing this interface provide a n-dimensional kernel function evaluating objects of type double [] representing a n-dimensional real-valued vector.
 

Class Summary
AbstractKernelCDF One main problem of nonparametric statistics is the estimation of the probability density function (pdf) of a random variable.
AbstractKernelDensityEstimator One main problem of nonparametric statistics is the estimation of the probability density function (pdf) of a random variable.
AdaBandKernelDensityEstimatorND This class provides a native implementation of a n-dimensional kernel based density estimator based upon a sample of data given by objects of type double [].
BiweightKernel This class models the Biweight kernel function.
CosineArchKernel This class models the CosineArch kernel function.
DifferenceKernelEstimator This class provides a difference kernel estimator (dke).
EpanechnikowKernel This class models the Epanechnikow kernel function.
GaussianKernel This class models the Gaussian kernel function.
HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction In the context of online aggregation, running aggregates are built.
HybridKernelCDF This class provides an implementation of a kernel based estimator for a cumulative distribution function (cdf).
HybridKernelDensityEstimator This class provides an implementation of a kernel based density estimator based upon a simple random sample for data given by objects of type Number.
KernelBandwidths One main problem of nonparametric statistics is the estimation of the probability density function (pdf) of a random variable.
KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction In the context of online aggregation, running aggregates are built.
KernelFunction This class provides the usage of kernel functions for statistical purposes.
Kernels This class provides some static methods for computing respectively processing kernel estimators and the corresponding bandwidths, e.g., estimating the roughness of function.
NativeKernelCDF This class implements an abstract preimplementation of a kernel based cdf estimator AbstractKernelCDF that doesn't use an explicit technique for avoiding boundary effects.
NativeKernelDensityEstimator This class implements an abstract preimplementation of a kernel based pdf estimator AbstractKernelDensityEstimator that doesn't use an explicit technique for avoiding boundary effects.
ProductKernelFunction This class provides the product of a given one-dimensional kernel function for using it as a n-dimensional real-valued kernel function as modelled in KernelFunctionND.
ProductKernelFunction.Biweight This class provides a n-dimensional product kernel function based upon the one-dimensional biweight kernel.
ProductKernelFunction.Epanechnikow This class provides a n-dimensional product kernel function based upon the one-dimensional epanechnikow kernel.
ReflectionKernelCDF This class implements an abstract preimplementation of a kernel based cdf estimator AbstractKernelCDF that uses reflection for avoiding boundary effects.
ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator This class implements an abstract preimplementation of a kernel based pdf estimator AbstractKernelDensityEstimator that uses reflection for avoiding boundary effects.
TransformedKernelFunction This class provides a transformation of a one-dimensional kernel function with restricted support to [-1,1] like the epanechnikow kernel function or the biweight kernel function to an interval given by [l,l+c].
TriweightKernel This class models the Triweight kernel function.
UniformKernel This class models the Uniform kernel function.
 

Package xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels Description

The package xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels provides concrete kernels and abstract modellings. This includes one- and multidimensional kernels. Also, kernel based estimators for an unknown density or an unknown cumulative distribution function are provided. Since the bandwidth of of a kernel-based estimator is crucial for its quality, different strategies for the computation are available. For a more detailled coverage of kernel estimations we refer to [Sco92]: D. Scott, Multivariate Density Estimation: Theory, Practice, and Visualization, 1992.
